(This does not seem to be driven by lacking access to the disability services office, more so difficulty getting instructors to “believe” they need the accommodation)
Needless to say, do not force your students to go to class. In fact, you can help them a ton by being up front and open in your support that they attend remote for all classes.

They were told they could transition completely remote “when and if the rest of the university needs to go remote.” 

It isn’t a disability accommodation if the disabled students only have access when non-disabled students need the thing.

In case you’re wondering why disabled people, especially disabled students/faculty/staff/instructors, are really annoyed right now, it should be stated that I have multiple students struggling to secure accommodation to attend completely remote if class meets physically.
